data.text:
Prabh Deep gets introspective with his latest release Pandemic

Team Radio City

New Delhi-based rapper Prabh Deep, hailed as India's most fearless rapper, has always been vocal and outspoken about the issues that matter through his slick verses.

Amidst the COVID 19 outbreak that has gripped the nation with the Prime Minister announcing a 21-day lockdown, Prabh Deep has digitally released his latest single, 'Pandemic' through Azadi Records.

Through the song, Prabh Deep asks us to look into how our greed has taken a toll on mankind and how the disease is nature's way of reminding us to mend our ways before it's too late.

Produced by the rapper with visuals by Anurag Sharma, the song is now available on the official YouTube channel of the artist.

Home > Freedom > Discover > > Swadesi infuses the Mahabharata narrative in the official music video of Jung

Swadesi infuses the Mahabharata narrative in the official music video of Jung

Team Radio City

Hip-hop collective Swadesi is out with the music video of their latest single 'Jung' from their debut album, 'Chetavni'.

A Graphic India Production, the music video uses the narrative of the famous Kurukshetra battle of 18 days from the Mahabharata, to highlight how our society and the world at large are waging wars to fulfil their own selfish purposes.

In a press release, the band echoes this thought, Our nation and the world we live in is always forced to fight against each other, for natural resources, power etc. Friends, co-workers, and relationships often fall prey to such mind-filled wars amongst each other. What we fail to realise is the ones who instigate wars are all on one side, creating wars to keep the people controlled by them and making them fight against each other. It highlights the fact the people who fight wars are the losers and the ones who instigate them walk away unscathed.'

Teaming up with producer Naar, the theme of the video has been created by Grant Morrison.

The debut album is now streaming worldwide.

Home > Freedom > Discover > > The Yellow Diary offers a soulful twist to Rab Raakha alongwith Akasa

The Yellow Diary offers a soulful twist to Rab Raakha alongwith Akasa

Team Radio City

Hindi Alt rock band The Yellow Diary had a great start to 2020. It started with the release of their immensely loved single, 'Rab Raakha', which has been streaming across all platforms to overwhelming fan love and reception. The band even went on a multi-city tour across India to promote their song.

Now, with social anxiety and emotions on the lowside with the nation-wide lockdown in motion, the band decided to release a brand new version of the song, titled, 'Dhoondti Firaan', in collaboration with pop princess Akasa.

The treatment may differ but the sentiment remains. That no matter where we are, we must believe that someone above us all is watching over us. The song fills us with hope and compassion and makes us look forward to better days ahead.

On her collaboration with the band, Akasa comments, 'I have always been an admirer of The Yellow Diary's songs, 'Rab Raakha', of course, is my favourite. I am very excited to be collaborating with such a talented band. 'Dhoondti Firaan' will definitely fill hearts with positivity and light, which is the need of the hour."

'Dhoondti Firaan' is now available across all leading streaming platforms.

Home > Freedom > Discover > > City Life by Raghav Meattle is an easy, reflective reminder about an unforgiving rat race

City Life by Raghav Meattle is an easy, reflective reminder about an unforgiving rat race

Team Radio City

If the lockdown has left you weary and worried, then singer-songwriter Raghav Meattle's latest single is the comfort blanket you need to slip into for solace.

Paying an ode to the monotony and mundanity that follows the lives of the young and reckless in the city of dreams, Raghav's 'City Life' makes for easy listening with its thoughtful verses and plaintive yet liberating melody.

The music video of the song dropped on YouTube last week, which has been shot on a good, old Kodak 8 MM film by Abhimanyu Sengupta. Directed and edited by Rajdip Ray, who first spotted Meattle rendering an exclusive preview of the song on Abish Mathew's 'Son of Abish', the video captures the nostalgia and the old-world charm of Mumbai seeped within the hustle and bustle of an everyday routine.

'City Life' also marks Meattle's collaboration with indie music's biggest talents on board including Karun Kannampilly and Jason D'Souza from The Koniac Net on drums and guitars respectively, bass by Nishant Nagar, mixed by producer Zain Calcuttawala and mastered by Skyharbor's guitarist Keshav Dhar.

Following up the success of his debut album 'Songs from a Matchbox' in 2018, to his recent collaboration with Vernon Noronha on 'Dream Sandwich' in 2019, Raghav has released 'City Life' while also dabbling in his day-job as head of marketing for the music label, Big Bang Music.

The song is now available on YouTube and across major music streaming platforms.

Home > Freedom > Discover > > Pratika Prabhune releases the easy electronic single, To The High with Daira's Piyush Kapoor

Pratika Prabhune releases the easy electronic single, To The High with Daira's Piyush Kapoor

Team Radio City

For many familiar with the Indian independent music scene, Pratika Prabhune is a name synonymous with everything home-grown and self-made. The Mumbai-based artist does not shy away from experimenting with genres as far as her musical aspirations are concerned nor does she refrain from indulging in different playgrounds of the music fraternity, whether its event management, artist and repertoire or digital marketing.

Adding another feather to her hat, the artist has just released her latest single, 'To The High' in collaboration with Daira frontman Piyush Kapoor. The single is replete with varied influences of the duo including electronic, dance and pop. The song aims at letting listeners appreciate and value the little and finer things in life, while everyone is held indoors.

A music video has also been officially streaming on Pratika's official YouTube channel, since the past fortnight, which features Piyush too, alongside the songwriter.

Pro-actively, Pratika performs as the vocalist for the Mumbai-based five piece metal band, Chronic Phobia and also doles out verses as MC PEP.

You can listen to the song which is streaming currently on Radio City Freedom.

Home > Freedom > Discover > > Mumbai-based upcoming rapper Krantinaari releases her debut single showcasing gender debate

Mumbai-based upcoming rapper Krantinaari releases her debut single showcasing gender debate

Team Radio City

Ashwini Hiremath aka Krantinaari has released her debut single by the same name, earlier last week.

A reflection upon the life of women in a very patriarchal world, the song has been sourced from Ashwini's own findings about herself and from women around her.

She adds, 'While the song speaks the language of justice, equality and unity for women, it is also a word by a woman, for a woman and to the women. The track aims at motivating and bringing all the women together to create a harmony between the genders. Krantinaari is not just a song but also a ation of a woman's life in our modern times.'

Accompanied by Shilpa Gulhane's vocals, the track has been produced by Swadesi's music producer RaaKshaS a.k.a Abhishek Shindolkar and mixed and mastered by Joshua Fernandes (also Swadesi).

For those who do not know, Krantinaari is a multidisciplinary artist. Her stories evolve around her own experiences as a woman growing up in a gender imbalanced society. She loves to express herself through music and art. A firm believer of sustainable lifestyle, the artist has also published a book called, 'Earth'.

The song is now streaming on Radio City Freedom and Radio City Hip-Hop

Home > Freedom > Discover > > Swadesi hits out at the current regime with their scathing new release, Mahamaari

Swadesi hits out at the current regime with their scathing new release, Mahamaari

Team Radio City

Mumbai-based multilingual crew Swadesi return with a gritty single that takes a critical, in-depth look at how Indian society has reacted to the COVID-19 pandemic. Mahamaari, the group's latest single, features Bengali-Hindi rapper Maharya and Mawali, one of Maharashtra's finest lyricists diving deep into the failings of the Modi government in dealing with the pandemic and the general population's subservience to an administration that has obviously failed in carrying out their core duties.

One of the few artists from the Indian hip-hop scene that has built its brand on offering 'outspoken and bold' political viewpoints from the heart of the Indian youth - Swadesi are relentless in their pursuit of speaking truth to power. Produced by WhayL, Mahamaari is a refreshing change from the trap-based productions currently flooding the airwaves - going back to the humble beginnings of the Indian hip-hop of vocals being recorded over phones.

Swadesi released their debut album 'Chetavni' in February 2020, almost five years after the release of the seminal 'Laaj Watte Kai'. In 2019, they releasedThe Warli Revolt, a collaborative piece with Adivasi tribal chieftain Prakash Bhoir that became an anthem for the Save Aarey movement.

Home > Freedom > Discover > > Naezy gets reflective about himself and the nation with his latest single, 302

Naezy gets reflective about himself and the nation with his latest single, 302

Team Radio City

Following a freestyle session gone wrong during his maiden tour to UK in 2017, Naezy confronts the awkwardness of that situation with '302', his latest single which he introduces to us as an alter ego.

In association with his longtime collaborator Karan Kanchan, Naezy sets the record straight with his mean rhymes and verses that showcases his angst and rage against those who once looked down upon him.

In equal measure, the rapper also takes a dig at the apathy of political and religious ideologies that have polarized lives to fulfill their own selfish needs.

The rapper rose to fame with his breakout single, 'Aafat' in 2014. Fans and critics have raved over his songwriting which amalgamates countryside fervor and global sounds.

You can check out the song across leading music platforms.

Home > Freedom > Discover > > Prabh Deep comes into a brand new empowered self with Chitta

Prabh Deep comes into a brand new empowered self with Chitta

Team Radio City

adrherherhtheh

Home > Freedom > Discover > > Paradigm Shifts Chinmay Agarkar and multi-faceted Pratika Prabhune combine forces for Toxic

Paradigm Shifts Chinmay Agarkar and multi-faceted Pratika Prabhune combine forces for Toxic

Team Radio City

Noted guitarist of Paradigm Shift and Hook, Chinmay Agarkar and singer/songwriter Pratika Prabhune have combined their creative forces to give us a brand, new fresh perspective of nu metal with 'Toxic'.

A project by Agarkar's GrooveBot, his nu/industrial metal moniker, 'Toxic' blends influences from the early 2000's alongside contemporary sounds using heavy riffs and crunchy synth therefore offering us a headbanging composition replete with meaty breakdowns and dark vocal harmonies.

The artwork of the single has been conceptualized by Dark Matter aka Ronen Samson, a former Radio City Freedom Award winner for his album art in Paradigm Shift's 'Sammukh'.

The single is now streaming across leading music platforms and its lyric video is available on YouTube.

Home > Freedom > Discover > > Ahmer and Delhi Sultanates Zor speaks loud for a community battling its worst crisis

Ahmer and Delhi Sultanates Zor speaks loud for a community battling its worst crisis

Team Radio City

Following the success of his debut album, 'Little Kid Big Dreams', one of the finest young voices from Kashmir, rapper Ahmer Javed collates forces with celebrated MC and social activist Delhi Sultanate to give us a pulsating new single, 'Zor' which reflects upon the effects accompanied by the lockdown imposed on Kashmir since August 2019.

Mixed and mastered by Arsh Sharma with artwork by Zuhaib Bhat, 'Zor' is a fight to preserve the principles of freedom and liberation at a time when prolific activists namely Safoora Zargar, Devanagana Katila (Pinjra Tod), Asif Sultan, Sudha Bharadwaj, Mahesh Raut and many others have been unlawfully detained for speaking up against a tone-deaf establishment.

The song is now available on leading music platforms with a music video, currently streaming on YouTube.

Home > Freedom > Discover > > Raghav Meattle offers a heartfelt ode to homecoming with Back To The Known

Raghav Meattle offers a heartfelt ode to homecoming with Back To The Known

Team Radio City

Given the anxiety and pain induced by the ongoing global pandemic that has left many stranded away from their homes and families, singer/songwriter Raghav Meattle offers yet another gentle melody in 'Back To The Known'. Replete with lyrics that strike a chord with the young and reckless, Raghav's song is about homesickness and everything that comes with being away from home, literally and metaphorically.

Raghav adds, 'Many of us leave our homes with the hope of making something of our lives, and the song touches upon inevitable moments of vulnerability that come with it.'

Earlier this year during the lockdown, the artiste also released his single, 'City Life', which reflected upon the unending woes of a fast-paced routine

Home > Freedom > Discover > > Lost Stories collaborate with Zaeden and Akanksha Bhandari for second lockdown track Noor

Lost Stories collaborate with Zaeden and Akanksha Bhandari for second lockdown track Noor

Team Radio City

A few weeks after the soulful 'Mai Ni Meriye', popular electronic duo, Lost Stories featuring Prayag Mehta and Rishab Joshi, are back with yet another peppy single, 'Noor'.

In collaboration with Zaeden and Akanksha Bhandari, 'Noor', an electro-pop-folk track features a young girl waiting for her lover to return. As conveyed through the lyrics, the girl spins a wheel of memories as she awaits the return of her beloved.

Mehta and Joshi are creating waves having made history as the first Indian artistes to be selected for YouTube's Foundry, a global artiste development programme that supports independent artistes build their repertoire on their own terms.

What makes the song delightful is the music video featuring a panda that represents the emotions felt in the song. The visuals will surely bring a smile to your face.

You can checkout the video on YouTube and stream/download the song from leading music portals.

Home > Freedom > Discover > > Prateek Kuhad rakes up a storm on social media with latest single, Kasoor

Prateek Kuhad rakes up a storm on social media with latest single, Kasoor

Team Radio City

For the anxious millennial heart, nothing can bring more respite than a Prateek Kuhad composition. Over two long years since his chartbusting EP, 'cold/mess' followed by two world tours and multiple live shows, Kuhad returns with his latest song, 'Kasoor'.

Released on June 30 across leading music streaming platforms, 'Kasoor' is a special song as it establishes the singer/songwriter's fan-first approach. The music video which was simultaneously released alongside the song, is the first fan-sourced music video for the artiste. Made in collaboration with around 400 loyal fans from across the world, the video was conceptualized and shot by Jugaad Motion Pictures. Besides his fans, you'll also notice prominent appearances by actor Jim Sarbh, singer Jonita Gandhi and stand-up comedian Mallika Dua.

Following a mailer sent to his fans by Kuhad, the submissions from fans saw an overwhelming response as over 400 videos were received, amounting to 45 hours of footage that had to be shortened, in order to fit into a 3-minute video. Poignant and soulful in equal measure, the video captures real, raw emotions of human nature on camera. Over a few simple questions, one can witness a range of emotions on display. The portions featuring Prateek were ably shot by the production house through Zoom calls.

Prateek released the video on his IGTV which fetched over a million views within 24 hours. It's currently trending on YouTube at #13.

Home > Freedom > Discover > > Zenith and Charan offer a trippy ode to unfulfilled love with Tarse

Zenith and Charan offer a trippy ode to unfulfilled love with Tarse

Team Radio City

Following the success of their last collaboration, 'Karvaan', Zenith and Charan have teamed up forces once again for 'Tarse', an electro-pop dance single which reflects upon the equation between two people who are in love but are okay with staying apart. Charan's vocals compliment Zenith's trippy composition that evokes a feeling of contemplation and bliss.

The emotional cues of the composition is consummated by a crescendo, leaving the listener to ponder if love is enough between two people.

'Tarse' marks the fourth collaboration between Zenith and Charan after 'Junglee', 'Kho Gaye' and 'Karvaan'.

The song is now streaming on Radio City Freedom.

Home > Freedom > Discover > > MILI wants the world to reflect and hope with Keep The Hope Alive

MILI wants the world to reflect and hope with Keep The Hope Alive

Team Radio City

Given the gloom and despair that surrounds us following a global pandemic, singer-songwriter MILI gives listeners a beacon of hope with her new single, 'Keep The Hope Alive', a song she has penned and composed at her own studio during the quarantine period.

MILI says, 'While the world was going into a lockdown, it got me thinking about themagnitude of the situation. This is something everyone in the world is going through at thesame time and the emotions and thoughts experienced are the same. My new song aims tokeep the hope alive and spirits up as we continue our fight against the pandemic. As theseare anxious times, we need to stay optimistic and take one day at a time as we're all in thistogether'.

Known for her film collaborations with composers A.R Rahman and Amit Trivedi on 'Ambikapathy''s 'Parakka Seivaai' and 'Kai Po Che's 'Meethi Boliyaan', respectively and have attained fame for 'Badari Badariyaan' and 'Yatra' on Coke Studio@MTV, MILI recorded her 10 track debut album 'Written in the Stars' in Los Angeles with world renowned musicians who've worked with the likes of Sting and Frank Zappa in 2017.

'Keep The Hope Alive' is now streaming on Radio City Freedom.

Home > Freedom > Discover > > Chhavi Sodani experiments and ignites hope and positivity with new single, Jaag

Chhavi Sodani experiments and ignites hope and positivity with new single, Jaag

Team Radio City

With her debut track, 'Banna Re' acquiring immense success clocking over 13 million streams since release, singer/songwriter Chhavi Sodani has released her second song, 'Jaag' in July 2020.

A beacon of hope and light in adverse times, Chhavi has blended spoken poetry with pop influences to lend an easy, happy dimension to the song. Through her song, Chhavi hopes that listeners will connect with the theme of introspection and rediscover motivation to aspire the best versions of themselves.

Originally from Hyderabad, Chhavi moved to Mumbai following her stint on the reality music show, Fame Gurukul, where she emerged as one of the twelve finalists. Besides being a singer/songwriter, she is also a music producer and a poet.

'Jaag' is now streaming on Radio City Freedom.

Home > Freedom > Discover > > Nikhil DSouza revisits familiar lanes of love through his latest EP Waqt

Nikhil DSouza revisits familiar lanes of love through his latest EP Waqt

Team Radio City

Known for his prolific film songs in the Hindi industry, singer-songwriter Nikhil D'Souza weaves delightful narratives through his latest EP, 'Waqt'. An ode to old-school romance that once bore innocence and naivety, D'Souza hopes his new line up of songs evoke nostalgia for everyone who listens to it.

Succeeding right after the release of his two-track EP, 'People' earlier this year, what makes 'Waqt' a must-listen for ardent fans is that it is the first elaborate effort by the musician in a long time to render music in Hindi. Given the adverse times, this comes across as an initiative to ensure that the reach is far and wide.

'Waqt is definitely an interpretive account of my personal experiences and so it truly holds a very special place in my heart. I'm extremely excited about this one, since it's also the single largest body of work in Hindi I have put out at one time. I do hope that these tracks take everyone back in time and evoke the same sense of love and nostalgia, as they did for me,' says the 'Sham' singer.

The artwork by Noopur Kabra resonates with the diverse themes explored through the EP. Written by Pinky Poonawala, the themes vary from surprise, regret and fulfillment. 'Gaye Zamaane' is a hat tip to old school love, 'Teri Tarah' is about the regret of letting go of a love that was wholesome, 'Hairaan' is about realizing that you may not know your beloved well enough, 'Thode Se Kam' is about finding someone who completes you and you look back at how life felt inadequate in their absence.

'Waqt' is now streaming on Radio City Freedom and across leading music portals.

Home > Freedom > Discover > > Anhad and Tanner blend the best of Indian and Western influences in debut album, In Other Words

Anhad and Tanner blend the best of Indian and Western influences in debut album, In Other Words

Team Radio City

Released through Gravity Sounds, a music label run by Gaurav Raina from Midival Punditz, comes a refreshing debut album by Anhad and Tanner, two diametrically opposite producers who bring in the best of their Indian and Western influences to offer us a mystical experience with 'In Other Words'.

In their words, they describe their work as, 'an album of exploration and discovery'.

While Delhi's Anhad Khanna sources elements of Indian classical music in his compositions, Durham's Tanner Willeford spins in contemporary jazz and Western classicals to redefine sounds from the Asian Underground with this seven-track album. Interestingly, the artwork of the album reflects the marriage of both influences.

The album features stellar collaborations including classical vocalist Pavithra Chari (of Shadow and Light fame), singer/songwriter Kamakshi Khanna, tabla player Sarthak Pahwa, flutist Vibhor Mathur, Vinayak Panth and Soumitra Thakur on sitar, guitarist Aditya Balani and vocalist Saptak Chatterjee.

Inspired by the works of Talvin Singh, Karsh Kale and Midival Punditz themselves, the album has been mixed by Raina at his Hauz Khas studio in Delhi and mastered by Graeme Durham at The Exchange Studios in London.

Home > Freedom > Discover > > SlowCheeta offers slick verses and introduces new talent through debut EP, Rok Nahi Paayega

SlowCheeta offers slick verses and introduces new talent through debut EP, Rok Nahi Paayega

Team Radio City

Chaitnya Sharma aka SlowCheeta is ready to pump his listeners up and leave them pondering with his 3-track EP, 'Rok Nahi Paayega'. Released through Ranveer Singh's IncInk Records, the EP traces an expression of unstoppable, indomitable spirit.

Spitting lyrics as if almost having a dialogue with his listeners, SlowCheeta charms you with his easy verses that speak about his journey and evolution as an artist who was once a young hip-hop aspirant, through the songs namely 'Chal Chal Mere Saath', 'Shwapon' and 'Wannabe Rapper'.

The rapper quotes, This EP is a piece of my heart. It's something I'm putting out there, so listeners get to know me better- Where it all began.. ? Why I do it? And what I dream of? It's 3 tracks, written in completely different phases of my life, and as the title ROK NAHI PAAYEGA suggests, nothing can stop me from doing what makes me the happiest- MAKING RAP MUSIC !!'

The EP also brings on board some of the finest, emerging indie talents from across our country. Music producers Mr., Doss and Ink Heart have lent their able production skills. Bengali folk singer Dipannita Acharya features in 'Shwapon' and vocalist Delraaz Bunshah has collaborated with SlowCheeta on 'Wannabe Rapper'. The music video of 'Wannabe Rapper' is out now on the YouTube channel of IncInk Records.

'Rok Nahi Paayega' is now streaming on Radio City Freedom and Radio City Hip Hop.

Home > Freedom > Discover > > Maalavika Manoj aka Mali questions the credibility of people in power with Absolute

Maalavika Manoj aka Mali questions the credibility of people in power with Absolute

Team Radio City

Succeeding the release of her first single, 'Age of Limbo' from her upcoming album, 'Caution to the Wind', Chennai's singer/songwriter Maalavika Manoj aka Mali raises pertinent questions through her new song, 'Absolute', demanding answers from those in power who have letdown people and their beliefs. The thought behind the song is well reflected in the artwork by Jan Juhaniak.

Heavily laden with keys and dreamy guitar arrangements, the song tips off its hat to the influences of the 60s and 70s when the likes of The Beatles, The Carpenters, The Bee Gees and The Beach Boys were crowd favourites. A soulful choir featuring Mali's closest friends accentuate the track further.

Produced, arranged and mixed by Arnob Bal and mastered by Kristian Montano, Mali has written and composed the song alongwith Jehangir Jehangir on drums, Stuart DaCosta on bass and Luke Moller on strings.

'Absolute' is now streaming on Radio City Freedom.

Home > Freedom > Discover > > Goa producer Anushka reflects upon social anxiety and validation through her second single Take

Goa producer Anushka reflects upon social anxiety and validation through her second single Take

Team Radio City

Anushka Menon who performs as Anushka, throws the lid off society's superficial lenses with her latest song, 'Take', succeeding the release of her sensational 2019 debut, 'Falling'.

Co-produced by Sid Vashi, 'Take' taps into one's constant conflicts with his/her inner self as a result of being at the receiving end of constant judgement and social media scrutiny that proves to leave behind toxic effects. Anushka urges her listeners to silence their naysayers with kindness, love and confidence. Mixed by the award-winning Salvage Audio Collective and mastered by Audible Oddities, the music video of the song has been released on YouTube as well. Directed by Ishaan Nair and shot by Sachin Pillai, the visuals instill a sense of liberation and freedom.

A renowned name in the world of fashion photography who successfully transitioned into music production through DJing as one half of Anushka + Agent alongside Smita Singh, Anushka has carved her own niche as a music producer whose music is edgy and is woven with a sense of aesthetics and authenticity.

'Take' is now streaming on Radio City Freedom.

Home > Freedom > Discover > > Pratika bares it all with her gut-wrenching new solo, Scum

Pratika bares it all with her gut-wrenching new solo, Scum

Team Radio City

It was epiphany when Pritesh or Prabhu Neigh, Pratika's brother and producer of the latter's latest single 'Scum' was sampling a beat. Pratika knew that a song was in the making and she instantly got down to penning its verses which would look back into a time and space where she was battling her demons on her own."

''Scum' is an honest conversation about how I used to feel - my thoughts going astray, along with people's unwanted opinions that I couldn't overcome back then. As you listen to the song, you will understand how people have seen me - from a heathen, to just batshit crazy for not fitting into their idea of normal. While I struggled with suppressing extreme thoughts, I was truly grateful to have my family around me in these tough times - whether to their knowledge of my condition or not.', she adds.

A multi-talented entity, Pratika has had an eventful 2020 so far with two successful singles namely, 'Burn' with Calm from Seedhe Maut and 'To The High' with Piyush Kapoor, Daira frontman. Besides that she has also featured in Tienas' second album, 'Season Pass', DefGiant's single 'Neon Dream' from their debut EP and on GrooveBot's debut single, 'Toxic'.

Home > Freedom > Discover > > Mumbai metallers Festacorn release official music video of new single, Raspberry Punch

Mumbai metallers Festacorn release official music video of new single, Raspberry Punch

Team Radio City

Featuring vocalist Vivek Jha, bassist Akhil Nargundkar, Angad Bhatia and Vaibhav Shejwal on guitars, Mumbai-based progressive metal band Festacorn have released the official music video of their first single, 'Raspberry Punch', from their upcoming full-length album, 'Slap City Central'.

Dealing with existential crisis, the music video ably conveys social isolation and alienation while uniquely blending live visuals with animation. The song speaks about the innermost fears of change that plague humankind as a collective. So while the people featured in the music video are shown to be having a great time, each individual is possessing a demon of their own.

The band has upped their game in 'Slap City Central' in comparison to their debut EP, 'It's Only Natural' with nuanced aggression in their execution while being mindful about the resonance they wish to achieve. The album is scheduled to release later in 2020.

Home > Freedom > Discover > > Marathi rapper Shambhos new single Man Soona, out now

Marathi rapper Shambhos new single Man Soona, out now

Team Radio City

Featuring Marathi heartthrobs Pushkar Jog and Smita Gondkar, Umesh Khade aka Shambho, a Marathi rapper has released his latest track, 'Man Soona', the music video of which has been skillfully shot amidst the lush greens of Maharashtra's countryside.

Reminiscing about love that is too good to be true, Shambho's raps are accompanied by Keval Walanj's vocals and the track has been mixed and mastered by Aakash Ravikrishnan.

With over 3 lakh subscribers to his credit, Shambho is a very renowned name in the Marathi hip-hop circuit. His chartbuster track 'Tan Tan Bhan Bhan' has clocked in over 11 million views on Youtube.

Home > Freedom > Discover > > Mumbai crew FTS gets pensive and confident with the music video of their latest single, Shark Tank

Mumbai crew FTS gets pensive and confident with the music video of their latest single, Shark Tank

Team Radio City

Frequency Time Space aka FTS, featuring Rayson4 7, Nuke, Specter, Quest and Tienas have released the music video of their latest single, 'Shark Tank' on YouTube on August 22nd.

Using the party game Shark Tank as a metaphor, FTS reflects upon life in a competitive world where the idea of freedom is confined to comfort and tentative pleasures. Produced, mixed and mastered by Tienas, the music video has been conceptualized by Shrey Did It.

A hip-hop collective from Mumbai, FTS dabbles with hip-hop, pop, space and elements, bringing in diverse perspectives and approaches towards their music.

Home > Freedom > Discover > > Mumbai duo Zia and Winit Tikoo demand freedom of choice with the scathing Meri Azaadi

Mumbai duo Zia and Winit Tikoo demand freedom of choice with the scathing Meri Azaadi

Team Radio City

Mumbai music production duo brothers Abhishek and Joydeep Dasgupta aka Zia have combined forces with the incredibly popular Winit Tikoo to question the existence of freedom of speech and choice in a democracy that is battling a profound sense of intolerance, keeping in mind the representation of the LGBT community following the abolishment of Section 377 from the Indian Penal Code in September 2018,

Titled, 'Meri Azaadi', the track was written and produced a year before the celebrated verdict, in favour of LGBT rights, reiterating the need of a voice and identity for a large number of lives that are constantly polarized by a banal, intolerant society.

With pulsating drums and strings, ZIA hits a remarkable debut, sung masterfully by Tikoo. The track is the first of many upcoming collaborations that the duo have in the pipeline with some of the most distinguished indie faces including the likes of Nikhil D'Souza, Siddharth Basrur, Kanchan Daniel, Aarifah Rebello, Piyush Kapoor and Anand Bhaskar.

'Meri Azaadi' is now streaming on Radio City Freedom.

Home > Freedom > Discover > > Bengalurus Roshan C Machayya hopes for a better tomorrow with Emptiness

Bengalurus Roshan C Machayya hopes for a better tomorrow with Emptiness

Team Radio City

Replete with an intrinsic use of ambiences and drums, Bengaluru musician and writer Roshan C Machayya has released his latest single, 'Emptiness' in collaboration with his musician friends, Rishabh Mansur on drums, Ritika Bhushan on vocals and Sarmad Ahmad on guitar.

Written, composed and arranged by Roshan, the song reflects the universality of the human mind despite functioning through diverse cultures, experiences and journeys. The lyrics convey a sense of hope that amidst the harshest adversities, the human spirit will conquer and emerge hopeful and regaled.

The song is the first from an upcoming EP in the works that Roshan is likely to release in September 2020.

'Emptiness' is now streaming on Radio City Freedom.

Home > Freedom > Discover > > Film favourites Yash Narvekar and Nikhita Gandhi team up with Australias Denny for Jhalle Kalle

Film favourites Yash Narvekar and Nikhita Gandhi team up with Australias Denny for Jhalle Kalle

Team Radio City

What's your definition of love? Can there be a fixed idea of falling in love? Each track has fairly piqued the interest of the listeners who are eagerly awaiting the release of the full-length album, which is an 8-track offering.

Coming back to their latest release, 'Moonlight Swing' touches upon the euphoria and thrill, a carefree rider experiences through his midnight escapades. Replete with powerful riffs, the song captures the spirit of the young and reckless.

The verses, penned by Tewari, is a heart-achingly beautiful ode to a love that never found fulfillment, yet served a purpose. The band further echoes, 'We've all had that first love that didn't work out. Sometimes even when things seem perfect, they do not go the way we plan due to reasons we are unable to handle at that point. We feel the essence of the song is the emotion of acceptance.'

Home > Freedom > Discover > > Zeus X Crona release new trap track, Bad Habits, a portrayal of toxic relationships

Zeus X Crona release new trap track, Bad Habits, a portrayal of toxic relationships

Team Radio City

Barely a month following the release of their last track, 'Back To You', New Delhi-based EDM duo Zeus X Crona have hit the musical charts with their latest release, 'Bad Habits'.

Released under Elysian Records in collaboration with Enrosa (former stage name Nilka), 'Bad Habits' reflects the ramblings of a young woman who is stipulated within the confines of a relationship. She is worn out emotionally, mentally and physically, yet she is unable to withdraw herself from her relationship as her lover is an odd habit, she can't seem to get rid off.

Talking about the release, Nimish Sethi, of Zeus X Crona said, 'Bad Habits is a very special track for us. The song is a dark and emotional track which tells the story of a relationship between a guy and a girl. We wanted to capture the emotional energy and intensity that we experience when we decide to walk away from something that was a significant part of our lives. With this track, we wanted to frame that type of energy in a positive way and there's nothing but intense, feel-good energy on this track, with crispy clean sound design'

'With this song we wanted to explore something different from the stuff we usually do. Not many songs focus on how you may want to spend the rest of your life with someone but there are times you need to be alone. This song not only evokes emotions but also makes you dance at the same time. We hope Bad Habits appeals to the people the way we envisioned while creating it', said Rishabh Bhola.

'Bad Habits' is now streaming on Radio City Freedom.
